hypothesis_content.title: Options-Driven Gamma Breakout Above Key Strike Clusters
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC approaches a large options expiry with high open interest call walls (strike within 3%), and price breaks above that strike during NEUTRAL regime with rising spot volume, it will trigger a gamma squeeze extending 2-3% beyond the wall as dealers hedge.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Options market makers are short gamma near large strikes. Break above forces hedging buys. Neutral regime has lower overall volatility, making dealer hedging impact more pronounced relative to trend.
entry_conditions: BTC within 3% of major options expiry strike with OI > 20,000 contracts
Price breaks above strike level with volume > 1.5x 20-day avg
NEUTRAL regime (prevents counter-trend squeeze in BEAR)
Break occurs within 48 hours of expiry

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back below strike price

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Break above strike fails to produce follow-through >1%, or price immediately reverts below strike despite high OI.
